Function Documentation

Bool oppCmdArgUsed ( optCmdParserP  parser,
const char *  name 
)

Return true if the named argument has been used on the command line.

Returns:
Path to object file if exactly one is specified.
Parameters:
parser The parser.
name name of the flag (without the '-').
void oppCmdErrorHandler ( optCmdParserP  parser,
optCmdErrorHandlerFn  handler,
void *  userData 
)

Install a handler to be called when a flag is not recognized.

Parameters:
parser The parser.
handler Handler called when flag is not recognized.
userData User data passed to error handler.
Bool oppCmdParseArgs ( optCmdParserP  parser,
Uns32  argc,
const char **  argv 
)

Parse an argument list using the currently installed flags.

Returns:
Returns true if arguments were parsed with no errors.
Parameters:
parser The parser.
argc Number of arguments.
argv Null terminated array of strings, such as passed to main.
Bool oppCmdParseFile ( optCmdParserP  parser,
const char *  path 
)

Parse a file using the currently installed flags.

Returns:
Returns true if file was parsed with no errors.
Parameters:
parser The parser.
path Path to an existing file.
void oppCmdParseStd ( const char *  client,
Uns32  useMask,
Uns32  argc,
const char **  argv 
)

Create a standard parser and parse an argument list. Use this if no custom arguments are required. Does not return if errros are detected.

Parameters:
client Name of the client (usually the program, argv[0]).
useMask Which flags are included.
argc Number of arguments.
argv Array of strings such as passed to main.
void oppCmdParserAdd ( optCmdParserP  parser,
const char *  name,
const char *  shortName,
const char *  argDesc,
const char *  group,
optFlagType  type,
void *  pointer,
const char *  description,
Uns32  useMask,
Uns32  userData,
Bool  mandatory 
)

Add legal argument to a parser. Adding a duplicate argument will cause a fatal error.

Parameters:
parser The parser.
name Flag name.
shortName Optional single character alternative.
argDesc Optional description of the argument.
group Optional group (clarifies -help output).
type Argument type (see enumerations).
pointer Pointer to callback or data to be modified.
description For help messages.
useMask Use mask. Each nibble controls a mode. n0=in eng mode, n1=product mode.
userData User data passed to callback.
mandatory If true, this argument must be specified.
optCmdParserP oppCmdParserNew ( const char *  client,
Uns32  useMask 
)

Create an instance of a command parser.

Returns:
The new parser.
Parameters:
client Name of the client (usually the program, argv[0]).
useMask Which flags are included.
void oppCmdParserOld ( optCmdParserP  parser  ) 

Delete an instance of a command parser.

Parameters:
parser The parser to be destroyed.
void oppCmdUsageMessage ( optCmdParserP  parser,
const char *  message 
)

Print this message with -help if command line errors are found.

Parameters:
parser Parser.
message General help message.
const char* oppDefaultApplication ( void   ) 

Return the only application specified on the command line.

Returns:
The only application specified on the command line.
